paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: Cardiac amyloidosis with dyspnea and left ventricular wall thickening

individual_records.phenotype_details: 2-year history of dyspnea and diffuse left ventricular wall thickening
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Here, we report the case of a 60-year-old African-American man who had a 2-year history of dyspnea and diffuse left ventricular wall thickening.

functional_data.summary: Mass spectrometry showed a shift in protein mass of 14 d, indicative of transthyretin and confirming the production of abnormal protein.

variants.segregation_data: Homozygosity for the V122I mutation may be associated with earlier onset of cardiac disease.
variants.population_frequency: Carrier frequency of 4% in African Americans.
variants.additional_notes: The V122I mutation is common in the African-American population.
key_quotes: Homozygosity for the V122I mutation may be associated with earlier onset of cardiac disease.
Transthyretin analysis should be considered for older African Americans with amyloid heart disease of transthyretin type.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
